intro: Campanolea mildbraedii, commonly known as the mildbraed's bellflower, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and is known for its ornamental value due to its unique floral structure. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
